page.title: 01HORSHAM GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The square (grid ref. 05160129) covers most of the town of Horsham. The survey was completed by the following schools Tanbridge House Comprehensive; Heron Way, Northolmes,Greenway,St Marys CofE(primary schools)and St Leonards Infants. Horsham's pop. is nearly 36,000. It has saxon origins and retains its old centre. Modern Horsham has expanded rapidly since 1960 and has attracted scientific and technological based industry. It serves as a commuter town for London. New housing estates have grown up and further development will follow with future expansion at Gatwick Airport. Horsham is the administrative centre for Horsham District and is the shopping and commercial centre for surrounding villages.
